body.p:
Greensburg Ky Dec. 22nd/60
To his Excelency ^the^ Govenor of Ky,
Dear Sir

Having good reasons to believe that a Petition, or Petitions, will be presented to Your Excellency by Fidella Warren, William S Warren, Mitchell Warren, Fields Skaggs, Henry Skaggs, & Co., all of Green County Ky. for the purpose of getting the fines remitted which were prefered vs them before Gabrel Close a Justice of the Peace for Green County, and knowing that said fines ought not to be remitted, I hereby remonstrate and protest against the remission of any of said fines. I as County Attorney prosecuted, said Gentlemen and I dont think they were fined enough by the Jury. The were fined for shamefully and, cruelly beating & brusing one W C Thompson -- it was proven that, the said Thompson without any provocation on his part was beaten almost to death -- (came very near ding) by the above mentioned Gentlemen, -- that while some of them were, upon him beating him with rocks ^the^ others
were standing over him with rocks, and one stood over him with his Pistol cocked and Knife drawn, defying any of Thompson's friends to interfere. The fact that I am entitled to 30 per cent on said fines does not prompt me to write, but because I think Justice demands the payment of the cint of said fines, Judgment has been rendered against said parties and of Course your Excellency would, not remit fees & cost. In conclusion I hope your Excellency will disregard any and all Petitions that have or may be offered by said Parties,

Respectfully Your
Servant Wm H, Chelf
Remonstrance in Warrens case from Green Co
